metadata.name: ESXi Admin Permission Assigned To Account Via ESXCLI
metadata.comment: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "system" and "permission" flags in order to assign admin permissions to an account.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/esxcli')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('system')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' permission ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' set')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('admin')))

output.summary: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "system" and "permission" flags in order to assign admin permissions to an account.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activities Reference: https://developer.broadcom.com/xapis/esxcli-command-reference/7.0.0/namespace/esxcli_system.html
